raw_message: The earth is estimated at 4.5 billion years old. They have only been recording temperatures on earth since 1850. So let's see, we are suppose to come to a drastic conclusion based on 168 years of temperature records on a planet that's 4.5 BILLION YEARS OLD? I'm just guessing but I would bet at some period during the 4.5 billion years the earth was hotter than it is now. They also changed the name to climate change because it's hard to convince people of global warming when it's 40 below zero in the winter. Now they say it's 40 below because of climate change. You people want it both ways when your THEORIES don't work out in your favor. Who's the DOLT?

raw_message:
No. While I am a former journalist and assistant professor at a large university system, I don’t believe in politically correct feel-good baloney. An example would be artificially lifting someone’s self-esteem based on anything other than merit. I don’t believe in the unspoken, facile view current in academia that, to steal and misquote a bit from Keats, that

“Diversity is God, Racism the Devil,”—that is all
Ye need know on earth, and all ye need to know.

Ye actually need know much more. No, my brand of liberal views developed not directly from academia, but indirectly. One of the grad schools I attended offered reasonable health insurance for grad students, and another didn’t. It was at the latter that I learned the truth about medicine having an inelastic demand curve (look it up). As such, medicine does not fit well into the free-market system. Over all, the US pays far more than necessary due to useless things, like insurance companies, drug advertising, and missed opportunity by the mostly Republican ban on the US colllectively bargaining with drug companies. Canada can, and that’s why drugs are cheaper there. You don’t realize it but your own Republican Party is seriously ripping you off. If anyone is brainwashed, it’s you.
message:
No. While I am a former journalist and assistant professor at a large university system, I don’t believe in politically correct feel-good baloney. An example would be artificially lifting someone’s self-esteem based on anything other than merit. I don’t believe in the unspoken, facile view current in academia that, to steal and misquote a bit from Keats, that

“Diversity is God, Racism the Devil,”—that is all
Ye need know on earth, and all ye need to know.

Ye actually need know much more. No, my brand of liberal views developed not directly from academia, but indirectly. One of the grad schools I attended offered reasonable health insurance for grad students, and another didn’t. It was at the latter that I learned the truth about medicine having an inelastic demand curve (look it up). As such, medicine does not fit well into the free-market system. Over all, the US pays far more than necessary due to useless things, like insurance companies, drug advertising, and missed opportunity by the mostly Republican ban on the US colllectively bargaining with drug companies. Canada can, and that’s why drugs are cheaper there. You don’t realize it but your own Republican Party is seriously ripping you off. If anyone is brainwashed, it’s you.
